Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can illustrate a basic image of a string telephone, showing two cups connected by a string.
The student can depict two people on either end of the string telephone to suggest communication.
The student might label the cups and string correctly, showing an understanding of the materials involved.
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to accurately demonstrate in their drawing how the device functions to transmit sound. (e.g., no sound waves or explanation of sound travel through the string)

The student may not clearly show how the device helps in communication over a distance or highlight its technological importance in daily life. (e.g., no depiction of distance or context of conversation)
The student may misunderstand the role of tension in the string, leaving it slack in the drawing which implies it can't function properly.
The drawing may lack an explicit explanation of how the device works to send and receive information.
